result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark A Lardinois was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).
  • Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (3 or more 1st degree acts), a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.025(1)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Costs of the action have been paid in full. Pay supervision fees as ordered by Dept. of Corrections.

No contact direct or indirect with ELH, KLH, TLL, KH, AH without prior approval of victim and Dept. of Corrections. No contact with anyone under age 18 without prior approval of Dept. of Corrections. Not to establish dating relationships without prior approval of Dept. of Corrections.

Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment. Submit DNA sample. Compliance with SORP. Costs of the name change action have been paid.

Victim counseling costs to be determined within 60 days. Costs of the name change action have been paid in full.
12/02/15 - Restitution has been paid in full.

ADDRESS INFO for Mark A Lardinois

from Court to DA re: Bay Counseling invoice
from State to Court re: EH counseling. Per Court, approved, plus statutory surcharge.
from State to Court re: counseling for KH. Per Court, $2020 for Bay Counseling approved as additional restitution and applicable statutory surcharge.
from State questioning 10% surcharge on name change costs. Per Court, yes.

Defendant Mark A Lardinois in court with attorney Mark D. Skvara. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, receipt of PSI. Defense advises of correction to PSI. Court reviews recommendation contained within PSI, advises that all correspondence/Victim Impact Statements received have been read. Statement made on behalf of victims. Victims' mother makes statement. State/Defense make sentencing recommendations. Defendant makes statement. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond no longer in effect.
from Defense enclosing letters in support of Defendant

Defendant Mark A Lardinois in court with attorney Mark D. Skvara. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters no contest pleas to Counts 2, 4. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds pleas made freely and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds Defendant guilty of Counts 2, 4. Counts 1, 3 are dismissed but read in for sentencing. Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties. Court confirms that Defense has reviewed sex offender registry, Chapter 980 consequences. Counsel request PSI. Court orders PSI. Bond continues as is.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 30, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Mark A Lardinois in court with attorney Mark D. Skvara. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises of charges in Oconto County, has reviewed discovery and reports, believes that Oconto charges may be dismissed due to duplicitous charges, venue will be here. If not, case could be consolidated here. Defense requests hearing in early 2015 that will involve plea. Defense will not be requesting PSI. State will be requesting PSI.  Plea hearing scheduled for January 26, 2015 at 10:00 am.
No contact direct or indirect with K.L.H., E.L.H. or their residences. Defendant can have contact with family members as long as contact is supervised by family member or parent of minor.

Atty Skvara asks court to amend bond to allow supervised contact with the grandchildren. State wouldn't object to supervised contact with family members as long as contact is supervised by family member or parent of minor. Court grants request.
Defense waives reading of Information in anticipation it mimics the criminal complaint when filed and enters not guilty plea. Atty Skvara requests a status in 60 days.  Bond remains as is.

Defense waives right to Prelim. Court questions defendant on waiver. Court finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds over for trial. Court finds probable cause for bindover. State will file Information and State's Discovery Demand later today.

Defendant Mark A Lardinois in court with attorney Mark D. Skvara.  Joan Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court.   Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel, right to preliminary hearing. Defense waives reading of the complaint, indicates defendant wishes to waive his right to the preliminary hearing today.  Status conference scheduled for November 10, 2014 at 03:30 pm.
from Atty Skvara with Notice of Retainer, he will be in Door County for another case on 8/26 if court wishes to address this matter beforehand.  Was initial appearance set at bond hearing today? PCD
No contact direct or indirect with E.L.H. or K.L.H. or their residences. No contact with any minors.   To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving the Justice Center.

Defendant Mark A Lardinois appears by video conference.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant ready to proceed with bond hearing without his attorney being present. State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond.  Initial appearance scheduled for September 3, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Defendant was fingerprinted 8/23/14 by jail staff.
